Description: Fragment of oval handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora at neck join. Clay near fine orange-buff; cream slip. Rectangular, rounded stamp with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie noted several such stamps in his 1884-5 diary (EES Archive XVII 47). Name Timarchos. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0219.45.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0436)
